chapter.title: Totem: Playing Videos
chapter.para: Totem is the default movie player for the &gnome; desktop. Totem provides the following multimedia features:

listitem.para: Support for a variety of video and audio files
A variety of zoom levels and aspect ratios, and a full screen view
Seek and volume controls
Playlists
Complete keyboard navigation
Video thumbnailer for &gnome;
&nautilus; properties tab

chapter.para: To start Totem, click Applications Sound & Video Videos .

sect1.title: Using Totem
sect1.para: When you start Totem, the following window is displayed.

sect2.title: Opening a Video or Audio File

step.para: Select the files you want to open, then click Add

sect2.para: You can also drag a file from another application (such as a file manager) to the Totem window. Totem opens the file and plays the movie or song. Totem displays the title of the movie or song beneath the display area and in the titlebar of the window.

note.title: Unrecognized File Format
note.para: If you try to open a file format that Totem Movie Player does not recognize, the application displays an error message and recommends a suitable codec.

sect2.para: You can double-click a video or audio file in &nautilus; to open it in the Totem window by default.

sect2.title: Opening a Video or Audio File By URI Location

step.para: Specify the URI location of the file you want to open, then click Open.

sect2.title: Playing a DVD, VCD, or CD
sect2.para: To play a DVD, VCD, or CD, insert the disc in the optical device of your computer, then click Movie Play Disc .
To eject a DVD, VCD, or CD, click Movie Eject .

To pause a movie or song that is playing, click the Totem Pause
button, or click Movie Play/Pause . When you pause a movie or song, the statusbar displays Paused and the time elapsed on the current movie or song.

To resume playing a movie or song, click the Totem Play
button, or click Movie Play / Pause .

To view properties of a movie or song, click View Sidebar to make the sidebar appear, then click Properties in the drop-down box. The dialog contains the title, artist, year, and duration of movie or song, video dimensions, codec, frame rate, and the audio bit rate.

sect2.title: Seeking Through Movies or Songs
sect2.para: To seek through movies or songs, use any of the following methods:

listitem.para: To skip forward, click Go Skip Forward .
To skip backward, click Go Skip Backward .

varlistentry.term: To move to next movie or song

listitem.para:
To move to the next one, click Go Next Chapter/Movie , or click the
Totem Next
button.

varlistentry.term: To move to previous movie or song

listitem.para:
To move to the previous movie or song, click Go Previous Chapter/Movie , or click the Totem Previous
button.

sect2.title: Changing the Zoom Factor
sect2.para: To change the zoom factor of the display area, use any of the following methods:

varlistentry.term: To zoom to full screen mode

listitem.para: Click View Fullscreen . To exit fullscreen mode, click the Leave Fullscreen button or press .

varlistentry.term: To zoom to half size (50%) of the original movie or visualization

listitem.para: Click View Fit Window to Movie Resize 1:2 .

varlistentry.term: To zoom to size (100%) of the original movie or visualization

listitem.para: Click View Fit Window to Movie Resize 1:1 .

varlistentry.term: To zoom to double size (200%) of the original movie or visualization

listitem.para: Click View Fit Window to Movie Resize 2:1 .

sect2.para: To switch between different aspect ratios, click View Aspect Ratio . The supported aspect ratios include:

listitem.para: Auto
Square
16:9 (Widescreen)

sect2.para: The default aspect ratio is Auto.

sect2.title: Showing or Hiding Controls
sect2.para: To hide Totem window controls, click View Show Controls and deselect the Show Controls option. To show the controls on the Totem Movie Player window, right-click the window, then select Show Controls.If the Show Controls option is selected, Totem Movie Player shows the menubar, time elapsed slider, seek control buttons, volume slider, and statusbar on the window. If the Show Controls option is not selected, the application hides these controls and shows only the display area.

sect2.title: Managing Playlists
sect2.para: To show the playlist, click View Sidebar , then click Playlist at the top of the sidebar. The Playlist dialog is displayed.
You can use the Playlist dialog to do the following:

formalpara.title: To add a track or movie:
formalpara.para: Click the Add button. Select the file you want to add to the playlist, then click OK

formalpara.title: To remove a track or movie:
formalpara.para: Select the file names from the file name list box, then click Remove.

formalpara.title: To save a playlist to file:
formalpara.para: Click the Save Playlist button, then specify a file name

formalpara.title: To move a track or movie up the playlist:
formalpara.para: Select the file name from the file name list box, then click the Move Up button.

formalpara.title: To move a track or movie down the playlist:
formalpara.para: Select the file name from the file name list box, then click the Move Down button

sect2.para: To hide the playlist, click View Sidebar , or click the Sidebar button.
To enable or disable repeat mode, click Edit Repeat Mode . To enable or disable shuffle mode, click Edit Shuffle Mode .

sect2.title: Choosing Subtitles
sect2.para: To choose the language of the subtitles, click View Subtitles Select Text Subtitles , then select the subtitles language (DVD) or subtitle file (AVI etc) you want to display.
To disable the display of subtitles, click View Subtitles None .
By default, Totem Movie Player chooses the same language for the subtitles that you use on your computer.
Totem Movie Player automatically loads and displays subtitles if the file that contains them has the same name as the video file and has an srt, asc, txt, sub, smi, or ssa file extension.

sect1.title: Modifying Totem Movie Player Preferences
sect1.para: To modify Totem Movie Player preferences, click Edit Preference s. You can modify the following:

sect2.title: General Preferences
sect2.para: The Totem General Preferences let you select a network connection speed, specify if media files should be played from the last used position, and change the font and encoding used to display subtitles.
General Preferences include the following:

listitem.para: Lets you specify whether to start playing the movie from the last position.
Select network connection speed from the Connection speed drop-down list box.
Lets you specify whether to load the subtitles automatically, and change the font and encoding used to display the subtitles.

sect2.title: Display Preferences
sect2.para: The Totem Display Preferences let you choose to automatically resize the window when a new video is loaded, change the color balance, and configure visual effects when an audio file is played.
Display Preferences include the following:

varlistentry.term: Automatically resize the window when a new video is loaded

listitem.para: Select this option if you want Totem Movie Player to automatically resize the window when a new video is loaded.

varlistentry.term: Also disable the screen saver when playing audio

listitem.para: Select this option if you want Totem Movie Player to automatically disable the desktop screen saver while an audio file is playing.
You can choose to show visual effects when an audio file is playing, select the type of visualization you want to show, and the visualization size.
Specify the level of color brightness, contrast, saturation, and hue.

sect2.title: Audio Preferences
sect2.para: The Totem Audio Preferences dialog lets you select the audio output type.
